results.title: 9 Great John le Carré Adaptations to Stream
results.abstract: From the beginning, his novels of Cold War espionage and moral ambiguity attracted leading actors and filmmakers. Here are nine that can be streamed.

results.title: New Star of ‘The Prom’ Sees a Chance to Make L.G.B.T.Q. Characters Visible
results.abstract: Like her character, Jo Ellen Pellman identifies as queer, and she is making her film debut in the Netflix musical alongside A-listers like Meryl Streep and Nicole Kidman.

results.title: The Best Actors of 2020
results.abstract: In a year of tragedy and isolation, screens were more important than ever before. These film, TV and TikTok stars gave us more than just diversion.

results.title: When Culture Really Began to Reckon With White Privilege
results.abstract: Black artists didn’t wait around for institutional change. They are making it happen.

results.title: How the Bee Gees Stayed Alive
results.abstract: The HBO documentary “The Bee Gees: How Can You Mend a Broken Heart” traces the decades-long arc of a band that mastered a rare pop skill: adaptation.
